body_content.explanation: the act of officially forcing a rule, tax, punishment, etc. to be obeyed or received again after a period when it was not used:
examples: The conference will debate the reimposition of the ban.
The farmers are calling for a re-imposition of agricultural subsidies.

body_content.explanation: the act of forcing someone to accept something, especially a belief or way of living, again:
examples: The re-imposition of law and order is the first step to getting the country out of this crisis.
They plan to revive their society through a reimposition of religious discipline.
